main event: A glowing orange object was observed in the sky over Columbus, Ohio on October 2, 1951.
interesting points: The object appeared to increase in distance from the observer.
The object was described as glowing, with no sound.
The size of the object was compared to a flash ball, and slightly less than a DC-3 fuselage.
The object faded and diminished in size, as though moving away.
The impression was that the flash was from a balloon.
